description:
Batman Confidential: Rules Of Engagement Part One

Another life lost, another child orphaned… another failure for Batman. But he’s about to be pulled out of his morbid introspection by an impossible danger – an assassin with a weapon so powerful it can vaporise a man in seconds. A weapon with Batman firmly in the crosshairs…

Detective Comics: The Beautiful People

Batman’s about to take on his toughest challenge yet – to disguise himself as an ordinary man. He’s on the trail of a well-dressed criminal gliding through Gotham high society, and you can’t go flinging batarangs around at a classy cocktail party. Not until this faceless villain breaks cover, anyway.

Legends of the Dark Knight: Urban Legend

Stumbling around with a bodyful of broken bones and no idea who you are is not a good way for a superhero to spend his time. And falling right into the middle of a vicious gangland war is even worse…

Reprints:

Batman Confidential #1

Batman: Legends of the Dark Knight #168

Detective Comics #821

Detective Comics: E. Nigma, Consulting Detective

The reformed Riddler gives Batman a run for his money as the world's greatest detective!

Batman Confidential: Rules of Engagement Part Two

Bruce Wayne's investments may be the Batman's worst enemy, as a Waynetech robot goes on the rampage!

Legends of the Dark Knight: Chicks Dig the Bat

Can a shy teen transform a Batman sighting into a date with the hottest girl in Gotham High?

Reprints:

Batman Confidential #2

Batman: Legends of the Dark Knight #212

Detective Comics #822

Batman Confidential: Rules of Engagement Part Three

The Bat-Plane blasts off as Lex Luthor tries to take over Gotham City. Luckily, Batman has Waynetech's gadgets at his disposal.

Superman/Batman: Absolute Power Part One: "I Pledge Allegiance..."

Superman and Batman rule America with a tyrant fist. All the other heroes have been eradicated. What's going on?

Detective Comics: Stalked

The plant kingdom has rebelled against Poison Ivy - now she needs a certain Dark Knight's help!

Reprints:

Batman Confidential #3

Detective Comics #823

Superman/Batman #14

Batman Confidential: Rules Of Engagement Part IV

The villainous Lex Luthor has sent a tracking device back to Batman's cavernous lair! Can Bruce Wayne and Alfred destroy the high-tech interloper before Luthor gets his hands on the most precious secret of all – Batman’s identity?

Superman/Batman: Absolute Power Part II

In a world gone mad, Superman and Batman are the tyrannical rulers, enforcing their will with brutal results! Wonder Woman and the spirit of America, Uncle Sam, are the world's only hope. A super-powered war is brewing, and the results will be horrific!

Detective Comics: Night Of The Penguin

Oswald Cobblepot is back, and this time he’s interested in… restaurant franchising? Has another rogue gone legit, or is something sinister brewing at the Iceberg Lounge? Whatever the answer, Batman pays the Penguin a menacing visit – just to be sure!

Reprints:

Batman Confidential #4

Superman/Batman #15

Detective Comics #824

Batman Confidential: Rules Of Engagement Part Five

A fully tooled up Bruce Wayne calls on his newest toy, The Bat Plane, to take on the awesome power of LexCorp’s G.I. Robots, which Lex Luthor has used to take over Gotham’s military base! Is this the battle that will make the Batman – or bring his career to an end?

Superman/Batman: Absolute Power Part Three

Batman and Superman are lost in time! Three time travellers from the 31st Century changed the course of history and raised Bruce Wayne and Clark Kent to rule the world! Can they escape this post-apocalyptic nightmare and fix the shattered time stream?

Detective Comics: The Return Of Dr. Phosphorus

Last seen fighting Ted Knight, the original Starman, Dr. Phosphorus was thought dead, but Cadmus Laboratories have a secret – he’s been providing them with living energy. But now Dr. Phosphorus is awake – and he’s angry enough to burn down Gotham City!

Reprints:

Batman Confidential # 5

Superman/Batman # 16

Detective Comics #825

Batman Confidential: Rules Of Engagement Part Six

Two industrialists go to war in the final chapter of the epic “Rules of Engagement”. Bruce Wayne and Lex Luthor face off – with Gotham City as the prize! But who will triumph? Bruce Wayne has right on his side – but Luthor, embedded in Gotham’s military base, has never been more prepared!

Superman/Batman: Absolute Power Part Four

In “A World Without Batman”, part four of “Absolute Power”, Superman searches for an amnesiac Bruce Wayne. Travelling through time, Bruce stopped the murder of his parents – wiping the Batman from existence. But Superman needs Batman to exist – the fate of the universe is at stake!

Detective Comics: Slayride

Writer Paul Dini returns to Batman Legends with a high-speed adventure pitching Robin up against the Joker! It’s just your usual night on the town for the Boy Wonder – foil some masked goons, take in the sights – be kidnapped by the Joker as part of a hit-and-run joyride? Well, maybe not so usual!

Reprints:

Batman Confidential # 6

Superman/Batman # 17

Detective Comics #826

Battle for the Cowl Last Man Standing Part Two

A new era dawns over Gotham City in the latest issue of Batman Legends. As Dick Grayson staggers to glory, a tattered cowl clutched in his hands, the enormity of his new position causes him to hesitate. A skeptical Robin pounces on the show of weakness, but there's no time for bickering - a sinister new threat awaits!

Batman: Reborn: A Battle Within

The role of Batman cannot end with Bruce Wayne! As emotions run high in Wayne Manor and trouble erupts in Gotham City, Dick Grayson steps into the fray, vowing to do things his way. Still, it's not just the crows that are scared when the first villain rolls up - will Dick ever get out of the Batmobile?

Batman and Robin Part One: Domino Effect

The all-new Dynamic Duo is here and ready for action in the latest issue of Batman Legends - but how can they fight the evil of the underworld if they can't stand the sight of each other? A slippery customer leads them towards an old adversary - can they put their differences aside and start cleaning up the Pyg sty that Gotham is fast becoming?

Batman: The Three Ghosts Of Batman

Gotham has never seemed so menacing as in this issue of Batman Legends – get ready for some classic noir imagery to burn itself into your eyelids! In “The Three Ghosts of Batman”, the Caped Crusader investigates police corruption and discovers far more than he bargained for!

Superman/Batman: Absolute Power Part Five

“Absolute Power” reaches its thrilling climax in “Thy Will Be Done”. Batman, Superman, and the resurrected Justice League battle to defeat Ra’s Al Ghul and the rogue Legion of Supervillains – but when the dust finally settles, whose version of reality will win out?

Detective Comics: Double Talk

Arnold Wexler was a quiet man who used Scarface, his ventriloquist’s dummy, to run the Gotham underworld – until he was shot dead, and his dummy’s head was crushed by a man working for crime lord Great White Shark. But now Scarface is back – so what’s going on in Gotham?

Reprints:

Batman # 664

Superman/Batman # 18

Detective Comics #827

Batman: The Black Casebook

The Caped Crusader is back. There’s only one place to find the newest, darkest and most exciting stories of the Dark Knight – Batman Legends! This issue's opener ‘The Black Casebook’ sees Batman confronting his worst nightmares – and most of the Gotham City Police Department!

Batman Confidential: Lovers and Madmen Part One – “It’s Funny”

What could turn a mysterious loner into the most amoral sociopath that Gotham has ever seen? Batman Confidential stories go right back to the first years of the Dark Knight Detective’s war on crime – the origin story of the deadly Joker begins in ‘Lovers and Madmen’.

Detective Comics: Sharkbite

Murder, mystery, millionaires and man-eating sharks – ‘Sharkbite’ pushes Batman’s detective skills to the limit! The Riddler is out of a coma and claiming that he has left his life of crime behind, but can Batman really trust him to help solve this mystery of the deep?

Reprints:

Batman Confidential # 7

Batman # 665

Detective Comics #828

Batman: Batman in Bethlehem

Visit a Gotham of the near future in the latest issue of Batman Legends! In "Batman in Bethlehem", Batman and Talia al Ghul’s grown son Damian Wayne has taken on the mantle of the Bat in a devilish Gotham: but can even he stop the end of the world from coming to pass?

Batman Confidential: Lovers and Madmen Part Two – “Peace In Arms”

Batman is faced with a new type of criminal – sociopathic, amoral and seemingly completely without reason. Taunting The Dark Knight has given the near suicidal Jack a reason to live – and to smile. The question is, how can Batman stop the rise of the deadly Joker?

Detective Comics: Siege Part One

In “Siege”, a technological terrorist attempts to blow up Wayne Tower, the hub of Bruce Wayne’s business empire. Who is he? What does he want? And as fifty thousand tons of concrete and steel begin to crumble, can Tim Drake save the day? Or will Robin need to find a new Batman?

Reprints:

Batman Confidential # 8

Batman # 666

Detective Comics #829

The Island of Mister Mayhew

A brand new Batman story by Grant Morrison and JH Williams kicks off in this issue of Batman Legends! It’s been many years since Bruce Wayne has seen the Batmen of All Nations, and his reunion with the strange, bickering crime-fighters proves to be mysterious and deadly.

Batman Confidential: Lovers and Madmen Part Three – Crime’s New Face

Crime has a new face in Gotham – and it’s smiling! The Dark Knight anticipates Jack’s next target – the Museum of Modern Art – pushing his sociopathic opponent towards his violent fate as one of Batman’s greatest villains – and even the Scarecrow can’t avert the course of destiny.

Detective Comics: Siege Part Two

In the concluding part of “Siege” Robin is stuck between a rock and a hard place, and both of them are about to explode! Vox, a terrorist with a vendetta against Bruce Wayne, has vowed to bring down Wayne Tower – as well as Batman and Robin if they stand in his way!

Reprints:

Batman Confidential # 9

Batman # 667

Detective Comics #830
name: Bat With A Vengeance!

description:
All Star Batman and Robin: Episode Five

Frank Miller and Jim Lee’s era-defining 'All Star Batman and Robin' returns to the latest issue of Batman Legends! While the Justice League plans what to do about the urban vigilante Batman, a violent Bruce Wayne stalks the Gotham streets, looking for bad guys to beat up!

The Island Of Mr Mayhew: Part Two

Grant Morrison’s story continues in the latest issue of Batman Legends with the second part of his Batmen of All Nations storyline, ‘Now We Are Dead’. The group of crime-fighters are being killed off one by one – can Batman solve the mystery to save them in time?

Batman Confidential: Lovers and Madmen Part Four

One of the most horrifying origin stories in modern comics continues! Bruce Wayne’s lover, Lorna Shore, lies in a coma thanks to psychotic bank robber Jack. Now, Batman has made a deal with Mafia boss Maletesta to have Jack killed – a decision he is going to regret!

Reprints:

All Star: Batman and Robin, the Boy Wonder # 5

Batman # 668

Batman Confidential #10

name: Kosmetik-Tips fur Teenager und Andere Idioten

description:
All Star Batman and Robin: Episode Six

Black Canary and Batgirl have taken over this issue of Batman Legends, and they’re here to kick some butt! As Batman bounces across the city’s rooftops, the girls of Gotham step to the front and show what crime fighting is all about in ‘All Star Batman and Robin’!

Batman Confidential: Lovers and Madmen Part Five

Something’s happened to Jack, and now a pale-skinned, green-haired maniac terrorises the streets of Gotham in ‘Batman Confidential’. That’s right, it’s Joker time! The Clown Prince of Crime is starting his first real crime spree, but Bruce Wayne has other things on his mind!

The Island Of Mr Mayhew: Part Three

Batman uncovers the deadly secret of the crazy island of John Mayhew in the latest part of master writer Grant Morrison’s Batmen of All Nations story. The Knight has a bomb in his stomach, Robin has been kidnapped, and a multinational crusade against crime is in peril!

Reprints:

All Star: Batman and Robin, the Boy Wonder # 6

Batman # 669

Batman Confidential #11

The Resurrection of Ra’s Al Ghul: Prelude

The earth-shattering, globe-spanning epic 'The Resurrection of Ra’s Al Ghul' begins in the new issue of Batman Legends! One of The Dark Knight’s more fearsome enemies is back from the dead, and he’s about to cut a swathe through Batman’s crime-fighting family!

All Star Batman and Robin: Episode Seven

'All Star Batman and Robin' ramps the action all the way up to eleven in this issue – Batman is mad as hell, and he’s not going to take it anymore! Black Canary is in trouble, while Batman beats up…well…everybody! Meanwhile, Dick Grayson has a terrible decision to make.

Batman Confidential: Lovers and Madmen Part Six

Check out the new issue of Batman Legends for the thrilling finale of 'Lovers and Madmen', the origin story of one of The Dark Knight’s deadliest enemies! Bruce Wayne’s determined to stop psychotic bank robber Jack’s killing spree – but the new Joker won’t go down without a fight!

Reprints:

All Star: Batman and Robin, the Boy Wonder # 7

Batman # 670

Batman Confidential #12

The Resurrection of Ra’s Al Ghul: Part One

Ra’s Al Ghul was presumed dead, but he’s back in an epic story that starts in this issue of Batman Legends! Batman and Robin have to do everything in their power to stop the 500-year-old supervillain, and Batman’s son Damian has to fight for his life!

All Star Batman And Robin: Episode Eight

Batman has captured the man who killed Dick Grayson’s parents and, under pressure, he has named the person who ordered their slaughter! Bruce Wayne’s psychopathic nemesis The Joker makes his first All-Star appearance in this issue of Batman Legends, and Green Lantern also shows up in Gotham.

The Resurrection of Ra’s Al Ghul: Part Two

Batman’s former partner enters the action with a bang in ‘The Lesser of Two Evils’, the second part of this global epic. Dick Grayson returns to Wayne Manor as crime-fighter Nightwing, but with the place swarming with ninja assassins, the reunion doesn’t go the way he expected!

Reprints:

All Star: Batman and Robin, the Boy Wonder # 8

Nightwing # 138

Robin #168

The Resurrection of Ra’s Al Ghul: Part Three

There’s only one way that Ra’s Al Ghul can permanently return from the dead – through the body of someone who is still alive! So Damian better beware! Meanwhile, Robin is in trouble, but check out Batman’s cool new outfit for fighting evil – talk about being the Dark Knight!

The Resurrection of Ra’s Al Ghul: Part Four

Bruce Wayne recently travelled the world to relearn what it meant to be Batman. He spent time in Nanda Parbat, deep in the mountains of Tibet, learning techniques that have helped him in his war on crime. However, he’s not the only one who knows where the secret, mystical city is…

All Star Batman and Robin: Episode Nine

We guarantee the Dark Knight’s yellowest adventure ever in this issue of Batman Legends – don’t ask, just read this mind-bending episode of 'All Star Batman'! Green Lantern is in Gotham, and he wants to find out what’s happened to Dick Grayson.

Reprints:

All Star: Batman and Robin, the Boy Wonder # 9

Batman # 671

Detective Comics #838

The Resurrection of Ra’s Al Ghul: Part Five

Ra’s Al Ghul has taken over the body of one of the monks of Nanda Parbat, while Robin and Damian have been kidnapped by Ra’s subordinate, the White Ghost. Batman’s son and the Boy Wonder have their backs to the wall – and their fists in bad guys’ faces!

The Resurrection of Ra’s Al Ghul: Part Six

Just how do you stop a six-hundred-year-old supervillian who won’t seem to stay dead? Maybe Nightwing has some answers, but first he’ll have to fight the brother he came to rescue – can he make sure that Robin doesn’t do something he’ll later regret?

Detective Comics: Kind of Like Family

Harley Quinn was the Joker’s psychiatrist before she went insane, but recently she’s been trying to turn over a new leaf. Should Batman trust her this time? And who is this new ventriloquist on the crime scene? Arnold Wesker’s female replacement is blonde, beautiful – and deadly.

Reprints:

Robin # 169

Nightwing # 139

Detective Comics #831

The Resurrection of Ra’s Al Ghul: Part Seven

The Resurrection of Ra’s Al Ghul wraps up in this issue of Batman Legends. Heroes, villains, pretty much every ninja that’s ever kicked butt in the DC Universe, and a rather cool new suit of armour for The Dark Knight – what more could you want from a Batman story?

Detective Comics: The Wonderland Gang

Gotham fashion week marks the return of Jervis Tetch on the city’s crime scene. This twisted genius of mind control may go by the name Mad Hatter, but you don’t want to get invited to his tea party! Brush up on your Lewis Carroll and brace yourself for this most literary crime spree.

The Resurrection of Ra’s Al Ghul: Epilogue

It all ends here! Batman thought his immortal foe Ra’s Al Ghul was dead already, but can he send him back to his grave? Expect the unexpected as this globe-spanning crossover story of epic proportions twists and turns towards its sensational climax!

Reprints:

Detective Comics # 839, 840, 841

Images: Part One

The Joker takes over this issue of Batman Legends to mark his first ever meeting with the Dark Knight! Batman’s war on crime is going well, and the police are starting to work with him, but will it all change when he comes face-to-face with his most malevolent adversary?

K Part One: Strange Flavour

When a meteor containing Supergirl crashed to Earth, it littered the planet with Kryptonite. Since then, the irradiated shards of Kal-El’s home planet have been turning up on the Black Market from Metropolis to Gotham. Can Superman and Batman rid Earth of the deadly material?

Space Medicine

Batman has been plagued by visions of three different Batmen. One was a policeman who dressed as Batman and tried to shoot the Joker in the face. Another was a policeman who took steroids and became a mindless, hacking brute. But who is this third Batman?

Reprints:

Batman: Legends of the Dark Knight # 50

Superman/Batman # 44

Batman #672

Joe Chill in Hell

It’s time for Bruce Wayne to confront his demons in this issue of Batman Legends, and that’s going to happen literally in the case of Grant Morrison’s brain-busting “Joe Chill in Hell”! Batman is on the trail of the man who killed his parents in cold blood – but isn’t he dead?

K Part Three: Varietals

Batman is aiding Superman in his attempt to remove every nano-particle of Kryptonite from the surface of the Earth as ‘K’ follows on from the previous chapter in Superman Legends #19. The Man of Steel goes on a freaky trip as the clean-up job proves more difficult than expected!

Images: Part Two

It’s early in the Dark Knight’s crime-fighting career, and now there’s a new, pale face in town…a creature of unpredictable terrorism – the Joker! The deadly origin story of Bruce Wayne’s most notorious enemy continues in this issue of Batman Legends, and the body count rises!

Reprints:

Batman: Legends of the Dark Knight # 50

Batman # 673

Superman/Batman #46

Batman Dies at Dawn

Grant Morrison’s psychedelic trip into the Dark Knight’s past continues in this issue of Batman Legends. Bruce Wayne, bleeding, beaten and gasping for life, is haunted by visions of his career as the Batman. Meanwhile, the mystery of the three Batmen deepens.

K Part Five: All American

Continued from issue #20 of Superman Legends, this story sees Batman teaming up with the Man of Steel to rid the planet of Kryptonite. Now the government is involved, the superheroes are up against Kryptonite-powered super soldiers, and pretty much the whole of the US Armed Forces!

Detective Comics: Trust

The magician Ivar Loxias has become fascinated with Gotham’s colourful criminal underworld, and now one of his assistants has been murdered on stage. Batman calls on an old friend to help investigate – ex-Justice League member and famed magician Zatanna!

Reprints:

Detective Comics # 833

Batman # 674

Superman/Batman #48

The Fiend With Nine Eyes

This issue of Batman Legends sees Bruce Wayne start down a path that will change his life forever, and it’s got something to do with an attacker who has eyes tattooed on his fingers. Secrets are revealed and mysteries deepen in the prelude to next issue’s saga “Batman R.I.P.”

Detective Comics: Trust Part Two

Batman and Zatanna’s investigation into gothic stage magician Ivar Loxias, whose assistants have been turning up dead, brings them face to face with The Dark Knight’s arch nemesis. Turns out The Joker murdered Loxias and has been impersonating him for weeks. Surprise!

The Joker’s Asylum: The Joker

If you’re not out of your mind when you enter The Joker’s Asylum, you will be by the time you leave! The pale-faced Crown Prince of Crime tells one of his own twisted stories about a televised terror he cooked up a few years back. This is Joker TV – and it’s so good, you just might die!

Reprints:

Detective Comics # 834

Batman # 675

Joker's Asylum: The Joker # 1

Batman R.I.P. Part One

The biggest story we’ve ever published in the hallowed pages of Batman Legends starts in this issue! Hold on to your hats folks, because nothing is going to be the same in Bruce Wayne’s world ever again. Who will live, who will die and who will be Batman when the dust settles?

The Joker’s Asylum: The Scarecrow

It’s The Scarecrow’s turn in the spotlight as the Joker’s guided tour of the Arkham Asylum continues. While other Batman villains commit crimes for money or fame, the once respected psychiatrist Dr. Jonathan Crane has only one thing on his mind – the study of fear itself!

Absolute Terror Part One

The Scarecrow takes centre stage again in this issue's Detective Comics story. The Dark Knight isn’t afraid of many things, but the Scarecrow’s fear gas manages to bring out all of them – and Dr. Crane’s starting to get a bit sick Batman dragging him back to Arkham Asylum.

Reprints:

Detective Comics # 835

Batman # 676

Joker's Asylum: Scarecrow # 1
name: Batman R.I.P.

description:
Batman R.I.P. Part Two

The stunning ‘Batman R.I.P.’ gets into full swing in the latest instalment of Batman Legends, as things go from bad to worse for The Dark Knight. Not only is a mystery assailant trying to destroy him, but it looks like Bruce Wayne might be losing his mind completely!

Absolute Terror Part Two

The Scarecrow proves that he’s even more terrifying without his signature tear gas in ‘Absolute Terror’. Since Jonathan Crane’s latest breakout from Blackgate, he has started leaving stuffed Scarecrows all over Gotham – some with bodies inside! Can Batman stop his reign of terror?

The Joker’s Asylum: The Penguin

Ghastly secrets about another of Batman’s rogues are revealed in this issue, as The Penguin takes the limelight in ‘The Joker’s Asylum.’ Oswald Cobblepot may have recently claimed to have abandoned his criminal ways, but he did some pretty horrible things in his early years!

The Joker tells a story of The Penguin's life from when he was a child and of him recently.

As a child he was laughed at by the girls at his school, so he tried to get revenge by unleashing his birds on the girls which began to scratch and bite them. After thinking that he had gotten his revenge, the girls attacked him with baseball bats. Seeking comfort from his birds he goes to stroke one which in turn bites him and in a fit of rage Cobblepot murders the bird.

In his later life Cobblepot rescues a young woman from being sold and begins to fall in love with her, but after she finds out that he has killed people, he sends her back.

Robin: Scattered Pieces Part One

With Gotham primed for a new gang war, Tim Drake, the third crime-fighter to take on the mantle of Robin, begins the search for his missing mentor. Still, as the Boy Wonder trawls the streets of Gotham, he has to ask himself one question – does Batman even want to be found?

Robin: Gathered Pieces Part Two

What would Robin do if he didn’t have Batman? Can Gotham City survive a rift between the Dark Knight Detective and the Boy Wonder? Robin and Spoiler are left fighting for their lives as the trail for Bruce Wayne starts to run cold. Can Tim Drake save his elusive foster father?

Batman R.I.P. Part Three

What would Bruce Wayne be like if he never became the Batman? The Black Glove’s hypnotic scheme to break the Dark Knight gets into full swing in this issue of Batman Legends, and as new, colourful super-villains attack the Batcave, Bruce Wayne’s world is in tatters!

Reprints:

Robin # 175, 176

Batman # 678
name: Death of a Family

description:
Batman R.I.P. Part Four

Meet The Batman of Zur En Arrh in this issue of Batman Legends, as Bruce Wayne calls on his backup identity after bring hypnotized by The Black Glove. Prepare for Bat-radia, sinister clubs of super-villains, and an almighty Gotham City tear up in ‘Miracle on Crime Alley’.

Final Crisis: Prelude

The DC Universe has been rocked by huge, cosmic events, each known as a “Crisis”. Each one has changed the DC Universe in some way, and altered the continuity of the major characters. Prepare yourself for the mind-shattering events of ‘Final Crisis’ with a special prelude in this issue of Batman Legends!

Batman R.I.P. Part Five

The League of Villains continues to move against Batman, and they still haven’t brought their strongest weapon into play – until now. The Dark Knight’s terrifying, pale-skinned, psychotic nemesis comes to the fore in ‘The Thin White Duke of Death’. That’s right, folks – it’s Joker time!

Reprints:

DC Universe # 0

Batman # 679, 680

Justice League of America # 21

Final Crisis Part 2 of 7

Grant Morrison’s epic Final Crisis continues in this issue of Batman Legends, picking up the non-stop action where we left off in Superman Legends #25. The Dark Knight and the Justice League are up against a cosmic conspiracy, with the fate of the Multiverse in the balance!

Batman R.I.P. The Conclusion: Hearts In Darkness

The heartrending confrontation between Bruce Wayne and Jezebel Jet; the final fate of the Dark Knight; the horrifying and shocking truth behind the Black Glove; and the origins of Batman Zur En Arrrh – all is revealed in the final chapter of Batman R.I.P, setting everything up nicely for Final Crisis!

Reprints:

Final Crisis # 2

Batman # 681
name: Final Crisis

description:
Batman Last Rites: The Butler Did It

Final Crisis continues in this issue of Batman Legends, but there’s also a special two-part story that bridges the gap between the multiverse-spanning saga and Batman RIP. Delve deep into the Dark Knight’s subconscious and behold a vision of Gotham City where Batman never existed!

Final Crisis: Superman Beyond

Zillo Valla has just ‘translated’ Superman to the Monitor’s home plane – in the form of an immense Superman ‘thought robot’. The Man of Steel faces the ultimate villain – even if he survives, can he return home?

Batman Last Rites: What The Butler Saw

Narrated by Sir Alfred Pennyworth, Grant Morrison and Lee Garbett’s homage to the Dark Knight mixes a surreal dream world and everyday reality in spectacular style. With guest appearances by some of Batman’s famous friends, it’s a fitting tribute to the world’s greatest crime fighter!

Reprints:

Final Crisis: Superman Beyond # 2

Batman # 682, 683
name: Final Crisis: Part Four of Seven

description:
PREVIOUSLY IN FINAL CRISIS...

DARKSEID'S evil infestation of the body of DAN TURPIN was complete, and humanity's FREE WILL collapsed into his control.

BATMAN's mind was attacked and his body cloned for a dark army - but he has just broken free!

SUPERMAN journeyed to the home of the MONITORS , fought prime evil MANDRAKK , and returned to save LOIS , only be whisked away to the 31ST CENTURY.

LIBRA now controls ALL the supervillians - using helmets broadcasting ANTI-LIFE!

BLACK LIGHTNING aided the escape of the TATTOOED MAN (a former criminal) and his family from a horde of Darkseid's JUSTIFIERS.

Lightning passed on a Darkseid-disrupting SIGIL to the Tattooed Man, who hid it in his skin. Lightning was then made into Justifier himself!

The Tattooed Man then made his next appearance in the near-empty HALL OF JUSTICE where a rag-tag group of survivors tried to hold out.

GREEN ARROW sacrificed his humanity to save his wife and the remnants of the LEAGUE , as they teleported to the JLA Satellite. THE RAY then patched the satellite into the remaining world resistance, including the remnants of CHECKMATE in Switzerland.

The SUPER YOUNG TEAM burst into Checkmate's castle and offered their assistance... but not before SHILO NORMAN aka MISTER MIRACLE was shot! Good job he always wears body armour...

It turned out that THIS SONNY SUMO is FROM one of the PARALLEL EARTHS... though how he came to be on NEW Earth rather than the wasteland of EARTH 51 is a mystery.

GREEN LANTERN , cleared of all charges, and with 24 hours to save the universe, attempted to get back to Earth.

In Blüdhaven, the diminished forces of Earth prepared a LAST STAND... as Darkseid's forces - and the FEMALE FURIES - ride out to destroy them.

ALL IS ONE IN Darkseid.
name: Final Crisis: Part Six of Seven

description:
Whatever Happened to the Caped Crusader? Part One

The Dark Knight is dead in the latest issue of Batman Legends, and there’s one question on everybody’s lips: whatever happened to the Caped Crusader?

A starlit cast of friends and foes creep out of the shadows to pay their respects to a fallen hero in Neil Gaiman’s classic two-parter.

Battle for the Cowl: A Hostile Takeover

With Batman gone, Gotham City has descended into chaos. Commissioner Gordon has lost his grip, and an old terror has reclaimed the streets. Gotham needs a new Batman – but who is up to the task?

Get a taste of the mayhem ahead of the next issue’s ‘Battle for the Cowl’ special!

Whatever Happened to the Caped Crusader? Part Two

Look out for cameos from Batgirl, The Mad Hatter, Clayface, The Joker and many others as two very different tales of Batman’s demise emerge.

Continuity and universal stories take a back seat as Bruce regresses back to his childhood and beyond in this amazing conclusion!

Reprints:

Batman: Battle for the Cowl # 1

Batman # 686

Detective Comics # 853
name: Batman is Dead... What Happens Next?

story_arc_credits.name: Whatever Happened to the Caped Crusader?

first_appearance_storyarcs.name: Whatever Happened to the Caped Crusader?

description: Says "nr. 1" on the cover, but it is nr. 2.
name: Casper der Kleine Geist

description: Says "nr. 1" on cover, but it is nr. 3.
name: Buffalo Bill

description: Says "nr. 1" on cover, but it is nr. 4.
name: Ricki Reich
The Fastest Car in the World

description:
The Riddler and villain team are in a meeting trying to figure out how to rid themselves of the super friends forever. During the meeting a news flash appears on television. An ancient tablet has been discovered with a riddle inscribed on its surface. This riddle promises "untold fortunes" to those who solve it's puzzle. Two teams battle out is riddle: The Super Friends and the team of super villains. 
 
Trying to buy themselves time, the villains send the heroes a clue as a distraction. Flash, Green Lantern, and Aquaman decide to investigate this clue while Superman, Batman, and Wonder Woman keep crackin' the riddle. 
 
Both teams solve the riddle and head to it's location to claim the prize and arrive simultaneously. They discover the prize was a fake and are met by the Duke of Deception. They both discover that the prize was just a way to awaken the Colossus of Rhodes! The Colossus goes toward the nearest city and starts destroying the city on his way. Both teams join forces to stop the Colossus and take Duke of Deception into custody.
name: Riddle Me This!

description: An amnesiac astronaut is helped by Gasolina, a muscular woman who dresses up as Santa all year round. As they travel New York City for one man's answers of self, it becomes an expedition to overcome barriers that stand between us and a recognition of our inner selves. IN TRUE MCKEEVER FASHION, META 4 IS A COMBINATION OF DISTORTED MYSTERY, DARK HUMOR, CONFLICT BOTH PHYSICAL AND MENTAL, AND FRIENDSHIP ALL SET AGAINST THE BACKDROP OF WRETCHEDNESS AND HOPE!
name: 1 of 5

description:
1. Spook to Me
 
2. Turned On
 
3. Wipeout
 
4. Bat Catch
 
5. Stung!
 
6. The Big Jump
 
7. The Invisible Rabbit (textual Max the Magic Rabbit story)
 
8. Flushed
 
9. Guess Who
 
10. Rain in the Mountains
name: Spook to Me
Algo Não Tá Me Cheirando Bem

name: Sky Masters of the Space Force

description:
Collects Batman: Legends of the Dark Knight  #1-5.  
 Bruce Wayne is tracking a killer through the mountains in Alaska when he becomes trapped in a storm and nearly freezes he is found by an Indian shaman and told a story about a bat during the healing process. The 
strange cult is performing ritual sacrifices in Gotham, Bruce Wayne attends a musuem exhibit on the Alaskian Indians and sees the mask worn by the Shaman who healed him. 
The Shamans mask was stolen from the musuem were it was being displayed, Batman starts investigations into the cult, then returns to Alaska to find that things are not as they were when he was their last.
name: Batman: Shaman

description: Coyle and Avery travel inland with new companions, and as day breaks they discover how far the deadly fingers of the virus reach.
name: Company

description: NOW AN ONGOING SERIES! After the revelation of a major character on the last page of the previous issue, what can you possibly expect from this issue of G.I. Joe: Cobra? How about the revelation of ANOTHER major character on the FIRST page? Costa and Gage begin an all-new storyline in a book that continues to dazzle readers and defy expectations.
name: Serpent's Tale, Part One: The Nest

description: The Murder of King Tut adapts best-selling author James Patterson's NY Times Bestselling novel in this exciting new series. As we visit the Egyptian landscapes back in the time of the Boy King (with art by Christopher Mitten), we also follow the trials and tribulations of his discoverer, Howard Carter, as he searches tomb after tomb looking for what most other archeologists are certain doesn't exist, the Tomb of Tutankhamen and the clues to his controversial and mysterious death (art by Ron Randall)!

“Car Crazy”: Archie’s infamous clunker becomes famous when the town newspaper photographs it for a gag shot. 

“It’s the Pits”: Stand back… Archie and Reggie are entering a watermelon seed spitting contest! 

“Fashion Sense”: Archie loves summer fashions… as long as they’re being worn by girls!
name: Car Crazy

volume.name: Archie's Pals 'n' Gals Double Digest Magazine

description: Las Vegas. Sin City. It’s a place where millions of dreams have been born – and even more have died. So it's as fitting a place as any for the ultimate gamble - a showdown between Jesus and his crew and the evil forces that have been gathering against them. But with the combined forces of the mysterious Hooded Man, Zombie Angel Gabriel, a zombified werewolf, and a virtual army of the walking dead, are the odds insurmountably stacked against them? Or will a new alliance and the revelation of a secret none of them saw coming be enough to even the score?
name: Volume 4

volume.name: Jesus Hates Zombies featuring Lincoln Hates Werewolves
